intro: Malva verticillata subsp. crispa, commonly known as the crinkled mallow, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves that are often crinkled or wavy, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy pink to purple flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
